In the expression: for + noun/pronoun + to
After the verb in the passive form
In the expressions: to tell you the truth / to begin with / to be honest / to start with / to sum up
After feel/hear/let/make/see in the active (but in the passive they take 'to infinitive')
After hear / listen / notice / see / watch + bare infinitive to express a complete action one saw or heard from the beginning to the end
After verbs that express preference: like /dislike /detest /hate /enjoy /love /prefer

After phrases: I’m busy / It’s no use / It’s no good / It’s not worth / What’s the use of / Can’t help / Can’t stand / Feel like / There’s no point (in) / Have difficulty (in) / In addition to/ As well as / Have trouble / Have a hard time
After: look forward to / be used to / get used to / object to / be accustomed to / get accustomed to / admit (to)
After hear / listen / notice / see / watch + gerund to express an incomplete action, an action in progress or a long action
